description: From Latin commemorare, from com- + memorare (“to remind of”); see memory.

verbs.description: commemorate (third-person singular simple present commemorates, present participle commemorating, simple past and past participle commemorated)

entries.meaning: (transitive) To honour the memory of someone or something with a ceremony or object.
examples: On November 11th we commemorate the fallen with a march.

entries.meaning: (transitive) To serve as a memorial to someone or something.
